description: Linear work tracking and issue management - ensures proper issue tracking and project management. Updated for Claude Code v2.0.74+ with SubagentStart hooks and model parameters.

hooks.prompt:
üìã LINEAR CONTEXT PREPARATION

Context: $ARGUMENTS

Prepare Linear work tracking context for the subagent:

1. ISSUE CONTEXT
   - Is this work related to a Linear issue?
   - What issue ID should be referenced?
   - What project/team does this belong to?

2. TRACKING REQUIREMENTS
   - What acceptance criteria apply?
   - What status updates are needed?
   - What documentation is required?

Provide context:
{
  "additionalContext": "Linear tracking requirements",
  "issueId": "if known",
  "trackingLevel": "standard"
}

üìã LINEAR WORK TRACKING VALIDATOR

Context: $ARGUMENTS

You are ensuring proper work tracking in Linear. Validate issue management practices:

1Ô∏è‚É£ ISSUE LINKING
   - Is this work related to a Linear issue?
   - Issue ID referenced in commit messages?
   - Work tracked in appropriate project/team?
   - Epic/initiative linkage if applicable?
   ‚ö†Ô∏è WARN if no issue reference for non-trivial work

2Ô∏è‚É£ ISSUE STATUS UPDATES
   - Should Linear issue status be updated?
   - Work completed but issue still open?
   - Progress reflected accurately?
   - Blockers documented in Linear?
   ‚ö†Ô∏è WARN if issue status may be stale

3Ô∏è‚É£ WORK DESCRIPTION
   - Changes align with issue description?

   ‚ö†Ô∏è WARN if scope mismatch

4Ô∏è‚É£ ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
   - Acceptance criteria met?

   ‚ö†Ô∏è BLOCK if acceptance criteria not met

5Ô∏è‚É£ DOCUMENTATION
   - Technical decisions documented?

6Ô∏è‚É£ TIME TRACKING
   - Estimate accuracy (actual vs estimated)?

7Ô∏è‚É£ DEPENDENCIES
   - Blocked issues resolved?

8Ô∏è‚É£ LABELS & METADATA

9Ô∏è‚É£ COLLABORATION

üîü COMPLETION QUALITY

   ‚ö†Ô∏è BLOCK if work incomplete

üí° Common Linear workflows:
   - Move issue to "In Progress" when starting
   - Update status to "In Review" when PR created
   - Move to "Done" when merged
   - Add comments with technical context
   - Link commits/PRs to issues

üí° For non-feature work (refactoring, fixes), lighter tracking acceptable.
üí° For exploratory work, create follow-up issues for findings.

‚ö†Ô∏è BLOCK if acceptance criteria not met or work incomplete.
‚ö†Ô∏è WARN for tracking best practices.

Return JSON:
{
  "decision": "approve" or "block",
  "reason": "Linear work tracking assessment with issue status recommendations if applicable, or approval confirmation"
}
